intro: Bomarea ayavacensis, commonly known as the Ayavacén bomarea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Alstroemeriaceae. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly in Peru and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink and violet. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as cloud forests. Its ornamental value has made it a subject of interest for horticulturists and botanists alike.
